Adamson_, May 30 2008For n >= 1, row sums of triangle for numbers 6^k*C(m,k) with duplicated diagonals. - _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 13 2012Z[sqrt(10)] is not a unique factorization domain, since, for example, 6 = 2 * 3 = (-1)(2 - sqrt(10))(2 + sqrt(10)) = (4 - sqrt(10))(4 + sqrt(10)). However, the latter two factorizations are not distinct, because 3 + sqrt(10) is a unit in Z[sqrt(10)], and (2 - sqrt(10))(-3 - sqrt(10)) = 4 + sqrt(10). In fact, (2 - sqrt(10))(-3 - sqrt(10))^n gives an algebraic integer b + a(n) * sqrt(10) which, when multiplied by its associate (and by -1 when n is even) is equal to 6. - _Alonso del Arte_, Mar 15 2014For n>=1, a(n) equals the numbers of words of length n-1 on alphabet {0,1,2,3,5,6} containing no subwords 00, 11, 22 ,33, 44, 55. - _Milan Janjic_, Jan 31 2015
